original: Derwik, Knut Ake, provinsial|läkare, Jämshög, f. 30/8/99 i Jons torp, Mialmöh. 1. G. 34 m. Margareta Djurberg. Barn: Kerstin Margareta f. 35, Barbro Ann-Marie 36, Ingrid Anita 38, Sven Ake 40. — Stud:ex. i Hälsingb. 18, med. kand. 23 o. med. lic. 27 i Lund. E. läk. v. Östersunds, Växjö o. Hälsingb. hosp. 26-27, tf. providäk. i ol. dis’tr. 27-28, assist:- o. las :läik. v. Svegs las. 28, e. läk. v. Hälsingb. hosp. 28-29, tf. und:-läk. v. ortoped. avd. i Malmö 29, tf. und :läk. v. Landskr. las. -s. å., v. Malmö allm. sjukh. öronavd. 29-30, und:-läk. v. Apelvikens ikustsan. 29-31, tf. und:läk. v. Malmö epid isjukh. 30-31, undrläk. v. Söderköp. las. 31-33, andre und:läk. v. Växjö las. 33-34, förste 34-35, e. prov:läk. i Kyrkhults distr. 35-37, prov:läk. i Jämshögs distr. sed. 37.
translated: Derwik, Knut Ake, district medical officer, Jämshög, born on August 30, 1899 in Jon's cottage, Malmohus. Married for the first time in 1934 to Margareta Djurberg. Children: Kerstin Margareta born in 1935, Barbro Ann-Marie born in 1936, Ingrid Anita born in 1938, and Sven Ake born in 1940. He graduated from high school in Hälsingborg in 1918, received a Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1923, and a medical license in Lund in 1927. He was an assistant doctor at Östersund, Växjö, and Hälsingborg hospitals from 1926-27, a provisional doctor in the old district from 1927-28, an assistant and resident medical officer at Sveg Hospital in 1928, and then an experienced physician at Hälsingborg Hospital from 1928-29. In 1929, he was the temporary senior resident of the orthopedic department in Malmö, then the temporary senior resident of the otolaryngology department at Malmö General Hospital and an under-doctor at Apelviken's tuberculosis sanatorium from 1929-31. He was the temporary under-doctor at the Malmö epidemic hospital from 1930-31, the under-doctor at Söderköping Hospital from 1931-33, the second under-doctor at Växjö Hospital from 1933-34, the first under-doctor from 1934-35 and then a district medical officer in Kyrkhult's district from 1935-37. He became a district medical officer in Jämshög's district in 1937 and remained there.
